thread.title: Amazing images of migrants at New York's Ellis Island
thread.title_full: Amazing images of migrants at New York's Ellis Island

title: Amazing images of migrants at New York's Ellis Island
text: show ad Ellis Island in colour: Artist brings archive of earliest immigrants pictures to life - including a portrait of the first person ever to pass through More than 12million migrants went through Ellis Island in New York between 1892 and its closure in 1954 US officials refused entry to some 250,000 people while 3,500 migrants died while awaiting processing The first person processed was Annie Moore from County Cork, Ireland who arrived on January 1, 1892 These images have been colorized by Irish photographer Matt Loughrey from Westport, County Mayo
